function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of detailed behavior tracking data","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Late and lax epidemic prevention and control measures abroad","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assumption about the means of transmission of covid-19","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Discussion of the status of the spread of covid-19 using early reported case data from the u.k., the u.s., spain, and germany","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Discussion of the potential of quarantine measures, hospital isolation measures, and self-protection measures to alleviate the spread of the epidemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Evaluation of the effect of hospital isolation measures based on hospital spatiotemporal distribution","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Global epidemic data collection may have involved exposure to the virus.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of public data repositories for covid-19 information may lead to exposure to malware or cyber threats.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Change from pcr fluorescence probing to clinical diagnosis without justification","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty and irregular shape of traditional unit for quarantine measures","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Irregular shape and data acquisition difficulty may lead to ineffective grid regions for disease control and prevention.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unrestricted contact between people within the grid boundaries before quarantine implementation.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient control over the distribution of the grid may limit the practical scope of quarantine measures.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unrestricted contact between people facilitating the spread of covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of quarantine measures allowing unrestricted diffusion of covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate monitoring and control of infected individuals","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complex spatiotemporal model equations may be prone to errors in implementation and interpretation, leading to inaccurate disease spread predictions.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate understanding of the distribution of infected humans in each grid region may lead to ineffective evaluation of intervention effects.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on quarantine measures, testing, and personal protective equipment without effective assessment of their impact and implications for disease spread.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spatial correlation of human activity and environmental factors affecting transmission of infectious diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of infectious diseases similar to covid-19 starting from adjacent spaces and gradually spreading to surrounding regions.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Need to determine the distribution of infected individuals in each grid region before implementing quarantine measures.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spatial correlation of infectious disease transmission due to people’s living and work locations","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Infection spread from adjacent space to surrounding regions","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission patterns leading to time series change in the number of newly infected people","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spatial weight concept used to calculate newly infected people in grid cells","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Tobler’s first law of geography influencing covid-19 transmission","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex mathematical equations for calculating infectious grid cell weight","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate implementation of self-protection measures such as wearing face masks, hand washing, and ventilation","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of adherence to maintaining distance from patients with a fever","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate understanding or implementation of effective self-protection measures","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spatial distribution of hospitals and number of beds impact covid-19 spread.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of contagious diseases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of intervention measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient data for epidemic modeling","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unreliable early stage estimated number of infected humans due to unknown virus characteristics and rapid interventions.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differences in patterns of movement of crowds and levels of economic development make it difficult to clarify which country’s data are most appropriate for simulating the trend of covid-19.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of genetic algorithm to estimate parameters for dynamic model of covid-19 spread.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient sample data due to short time period and unknown infection rates","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Large-scale detection program leading to underreporting of asymptomatic cases","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in using early small sample data to predict the epidemic situation","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differences in population distribution, population flow, and medical resource detection affecting the spread of early epidemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in confirming the actual number of infected people who had already exited but had not been tested or had no symptoms","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Influence of implementing quarantine with different intensities and intervention times to mitigate covid-19 spread.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on strict quarantines as the main epidemic prevention measure","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate reduction in infected curves with a small number of infected humans","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient effectiveness of quarantine measures due to population density and distribution","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Delay in intervention time leading to increased peak value, extended peak arrival time, and longer epidemic duration","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unnecessary use of strict quarantines in mild epidemic situations","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Demonstrated need for huge investment in financial, material, and human resources for strict quarantines","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"}]}
